alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 9:16PM MST until January 02 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. For the Oak Creek...including Cornville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM MST Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM MST Sunday was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 8.5 feet late this evening. It will fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 8.4 Sun 9 pm MST 3.3 2.5 2.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 900 AM MST.
